thread.title: Rajasthani author Nand Bhardwaj returns Akademi award
thread.title_full: Rajasthani author Nand Bhardwaj returns Akademi award - The Times of India

author: Bhanu Pratap Singh
title: Rajasthani author Nand Bhardwaj returns Akademi award
text:
JAIPUR: Rajasthani author Nand Bhardwaj has joined the league of litterateurs who have returned the Sahitya Akademi awards in the aftermath of the Dadri incident. Bhardwaj has cited growing religious intolerance, curbs on freedom of expression and communal attacks on writers as the reasons for returning the award. He has also returned Rs 50,000 that he received as cash part of the reward.
Bhardwaj, a well known author in Rajasthan, won the award in 2004 for his Rajasthani book "Samhi Khulto Maarag".
In his letter to the secretary, Sahitya Akademi, Bhardwaj has expressed anguish that the institution failed to standby its authors, protecting their honour and proving them security in "these difficult times". "It has been unable to as much as express condolences for the litterateurs, journalists and intellectuals who were murdered," Bhardwaj has written.
The Rajasthani author has praised the writers who recently returned their awards "saddened at the Akademi's silence".
